content:
Advanced Configuration for OmniScript Form Elements

This section tells you how to work with elements that enable users to input information, search for record information, select options, create records, edit records, and delete records.

For more information on all OmniScript elements, see OmniScript Element Reference.

Accessing Data JSON with Merge Fields
Enable OmniScript elements and element properties to access data JSON using merge fields. A merge field is a variable that references the value of a JSON node.

Adding Options for Selects, Multi-Selects, and Radio Buttons
Add options by going to the Options section of the element properties and clicking + Add New Option. If no values are defined for a Select element, an Undefined Value is returned.

Configuring Date and Time Ranges
The Date, Date/Time, and Time elements enable users to input dates and times into an OmniScript form. Each element has different properties that enable you to present a selectable range of dates or times to the User.

Tying a Picklist to Salesforce
Dynamically populate Select, Multi-Select, or Radio elements with values from a picklist in your Salesforce org, or using a custom Apex class.

Populating Picklist Values From Apex
Get values from an apex class that implements Callable and Vlocity Open Interface. The values are obtained during the OmniScript's activation.

Populating Dependent Picklist Values with Apex
Get values from a Callable implementation. The values are obtained during the OmniScript's activation.

Using the Lookup Element
Run a query using text input to retrieve Salesforce data using the Lookup element. The retrieved data is returned in Value/Label pairs and becomes available for selection in a dropdown list.

Working with Lookup Query Configurations
Filter results by using the Lookup Query Configuration properties section. Three main types of queries can be built: AND join, OR join, and Deep query.

Accessing Data Within or Outside a Repeatable Block
Use methods to access data that is calculated in a different element, depending on whether it's within or outside the same repeatable block.

Using the Rich Text Editor
The Text Block and horizontal mode Instructions use a Rich Text Editor to display HTML in an OmniScript.
title: Advanced Configuration for OmniScript Form Elements
